59
TESTAMENTARY CAPACITY
(1) Anyone who is of sound mind and has fulfilled the age of fifteen is entitled to make a will.
(2) A will shall be invalid if the testator has not yet fulfilled the age of fifteen at the time the will is made or is not of sound mind.
(3) The loss of sound mind occurring after a will has been made shall not have an effect on the validity of the will.
